description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the NTLM hash disclosure spoofing vulnerability (CVE-2024-43451), apply the following updates:

1. Identify your Windows version and build number from the list below.
2. Download the appropriate KB update package from the links provided.
3. Install the update and restart your system to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
These updates resolve the spoofing vulnerability by correcting the handling of NTLM hashes in the affected builds.

**Build Numbers and Corresponding KB Articles**:
- Windows 11 Version 24H2 (10.0.26100.2314): [KB5046617](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046617)
- Windows 11 Version 23H2 (10.0.22631.4460): [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
- Windows 11 Version 22H2 (10.0.22621.4460): [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
- Windows 10 Version 22H2 (x64): [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
- Windows 10 Version 21H2 (x64): [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
- Windows 10 for x64 systems: [KB5046665](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046665)

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system is running one of the specified versions of Windows.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
